meanings.sent1: The loud noise did not faze the brave dog.
meanings.sent2: Unexpected challenges can sometimes faze people.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly antics did not faze the serious magician.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor in the face of chaos never seemed to faze anyone.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouraging words helped faze the student's fears away.

meanings.definition: To cause to be disturbed or disconcerted
meanings.sent1: Please don't faze your little sister with scary stories.
meanings.sent2: The scary movie fazed the young children.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prank fazed the usually unflappable boss.
meanings.sent4: His confident speech fazed his opponents in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in plans seemed to faze the meticulous planner.
